column4: I still cant believe I have a partition with Ubuntu 9.04 installed on this pc, after so many years
A former Mac user says Hello!
We come from all different paths in the world
Man same here,its just that my macbook has stopped working :( so i run windows and ubuntu on this map :(
Oh no, not yet.. sorry, i thought i could chat here..
Thank you, and i apologize

I do have a question actually. Ubuntu 12.04.01 doesnt run very well on my computer. This version is alot cleaner than 9.04 that I usd with different graphical tweaks (compiz or gnome??)... I dont know why the last version is slow.. I wonder if there is any easy way to speed it up by disabling processes that i might not need or so? I hope this is a common issue and that maybe someone knows what to do.. if not, i guess my cmoputer is
just to slow for it
i would recommend that you turn off all compiz effects and disable ALL desktop/window effects

myself, i have switched to cinnamon. you can get the package with apt-get or aptitude. or just use gnome. also there are other managers other than unity (that is what you are using) which are much less graphics-heavy
how important is it to you that your computer look flashy
cinnamon is small, and it's beautiful - i really think yo should just try that.
are you opposed to trying somethign other than unity/compiz?
http://www.linuxbsdos.com/2012/01/05/how-to-install-cinnamon-in-ubuntu-11-10/
i sent the wrong link
http://cinnamon.linuxmint.com/?page_id=61
type this
no problem, thank /you/ for trying cinnamon, i really want it to get more popular.
yes it's still ubuntu. we do not technically support cinnamon
but you will have the option of using unity (as it is now) still even after you install cinnamon
at the login screen, in the upper right corner of the box around your name where you enter your password, you can click the circle & select cinnamon or unity or gnome
yw
